Data & Statistics¶

The data module brings several tools to make parsing data slightly easier. The main class to use here is Stats

class data.Stats[source]¶

Stats is a wrapper for all player and tournament data.

seasons: Dict[str, Season]
A collection of season objects mapped to their name.
players: Dict[str, dict]

A dictionary containing player season data, as well as their overall ranks for each season, mapped to player names.

For example, accessing player stats in the current season:

>>> players['John Doe']
{
    '2018F': John Doe (41 pts.),
    '2018S': John Doe (30.12 pts.),
    'ranks': [8, 17]
}

Season¶

This is a season salad.

class data.Season(name, season_num, players)[source]¶

Seasons keep track of all data for a particular season.

name: str
The name of the season, e.g. “2016F-FH”
season_num: int
The number of the season.
players: List[Player]
A list of Player objects that participated in this season.
classmethod from_file(file)[source]¶

Opens a local data file and parses the cell values. Used to create Season objects through Stats

Parameters:file (str) – The name of the file containing JSON data.
Returns:Season representing the input file.

Player¶

Player 2 has joined the game.

class data.Player(season_num, bonus_points, total_points, name, placements)[source]¶

Player stores information about one individual player in a season.

season_num: int
The season number (e.g. 7 for Season 7)
bonus_points: int
The number of bonus points awarded this season.
total_points: float
The total number of points earned this season.
name: str

The unparsed name from the raw data.

“Doe, John” becomes “John Doe” as name

placements: List[dict]

Contains the placements for each tournament.

Example placement:

>>> player.placements[0]
{
    'tournament': '2018F',
    'place': 13,
    'points': 7.49
}
